com.cedarsoftware.util.io

Class JsonWriter

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.cedarsoftware.util.io.JsonWriter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Closeable, java.io.Flushable, java.lang.AutoCloseable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    PtuJsonWriter

    public class JsonWriter
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Closeable, java.io.Flushable
    Output a Java object graph in JSON format. This code handles cyclic references and can serialize any Object graph without requiring a class to be 'Serializeable' or have any specific methods on it.
    • Call the static method: JsonWriter.toJson(employee). This will convert the passed in 'employee' instance into a JSON String.
    • Using streams: 
           JsonWriter writer = new JsonWriter(stream);
     writer.write(employee);
     writer.close();
      This will write the 'employee' object to the passed in OutputStream.

      • That's it. This can be used as a debugging tool. Output an object graph using the above code. You can copy that JSON output into this site which formats it with a lot of whitespace to make it human readable: http://jsonformatter.curiousconcept.com

      This will output any object graph deeply (or null). Object references are properly handled. For example, if you had A->B, B->C, and C->A, then A will be serialized with a B object in it, B will be serialized with a C object in it, and then C will be serialized with a reference to A (ref), not a redefinition of A.

      static void writeJsonUtf8String(java.lang.String s, java.io.Writer out)
      Write out special characters "\b, \f, \t, \n, \r", as such, backslash as \\ quote as \" and values less than an ASCII space (20hex) as "\\u00xx" format, characters in the range of ASCII space to a '~' as ASCII, and anything higher in UTF-8.

      • toJson

        public static java.lang.String toJson(java.lang.Object item)
        Convert a Java Object to a JSON String. This is the easy-to-use API - it returns null if there was an error.
        Parameters:
        item - Object to convert to a JSON String.
        Returns:
        String containing JSON representation of passed in object, or null if an error occurred.

      • writeJsonUtf8String

        public static void writeJsonUtf8String(java.lang.String s,
                       java.io.Writer out)
                                throws java.io.IOException
        Write out special characters "\b, \f, \t, \n, \r", as such, backslash as \\ quote as \" and values less than an ASCII space (20hex) as "\\u00xx" format, characters in the range of ASCII space to a '~' as ASCII, and anything higher in UTF-8.
        Parameters:
        s - String to be written in utf8 format on the output stream.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an error occurs writing to the output stream.
